properties.areaDesc: Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso/Western Hudspeth Counties; Salt Basin; Otero Mesa; Northern Hudspeth Highlands/Hueco Mountains; Southern Hudspeth Highlands; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern Hudspeth County
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 7:17PM MST until February 5 at 11:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE SACRAMENTO MOUNTAINS, THE EASTERN
LOWLANDS OF OTERO COUNTY, AND HUDSPETH COUNTY...

.Cold front moving through the area with drop temperatures rapidly
and change any precipitation to snow overnight. Some moderate to
heavy snow is currently falling over the Sacramento Mountains and
should continue into Wednesday morning. The east slopes and
central portion of the mountains are expected to receive the
heaviest snowfall as low level east flow increases throughout
tonight. Snow accumulation is expected across Hudspeth County and
the lowlands of Otero County. The snow should taper off and end
by around noon on Wednesday.

* WHAT...Snow. 1 to 3 inches of lowland snow expected.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with
a few localized areas up to 5 inches.

* WHEN...Rain turning to snow tonight and continuing into
Wednesday morning before tapering off and ending.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Local areas of up to 5 inches possible
near east slopes of terrain such as the Hueco Mountains.

* WHERE...Hudspeth County and eastern portions of Otero County.

* TIMING...From 11 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Snowfall will create slick roads and reduce
visibility making for hazardous travel conditions. Road
closures will be possible, including I-10 through Hudspeth
County.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY
